rComments: I took this professor's fiction course about ten years ago. She changed my life. She is the best Creative Writing teacher I've had yet, and I've taken many more after her. She pushed me to see myself as a writer, and continued to push me beyond mediocrity, especially in her comments on my work. Work hard in her course and reap the rewards.

Stacey was an awesome teacher and writer (I got to hear her read at an event) who helped me improve my writing exponentially. Yes, she is "tough," but you always know that she really wants you to learn and improve. Whiners and people who want easy A's should not take this class. She has an awesome reader for the class and a killer sense of humor.

Stacey treated us like we were in kindergarten.  We were required to check in with her before class and after breaks.  Her comments on essays were, although detailed, brutal.  Her comments read like personal attacks, so focused on me, rather than focused on my work.  She lacks heart, empathy, and  was both demanding and condescending.

No-nonsense, and I generally appreciate the approach. NOT a class for the thin-skinned! She will offer great constructive criticism and push your writing to its best, but she sometimes crosses the line into unnecessary and hurtful commentary.

This woman will push and push until she squeezes brilliance out of you. I loved this class because as a creative writting student I have never had a teacher who actually sticks to deadlines. I repect her for being strict about it, it made me feel like a professional writter. She is very demanding.
